snippet: The company has closed parts of its self-driving car project and laid off dozens of employees, according to three people briefed on the subject.

headline.main: Apple Is Said to Be Rethinking Strategy on Self-Driving Cars
headline.print_headline: Apple Is Said to Be Rethinking Strategy on Self-Driving Cars

byline.original: By DAISUKE WAKABAYASHI and BRIAN X. CHEN

snippet: The Dutch finance minister urged Apple on Saturday to "get ready" to pay up.

headline.main: EU Finance Ministers Line Up Behind Tax Ruling Against Apple
headline.print_headline: EU Finance Ministers Line Up Behind Tax Ruling Against Apple

snippet: Apple may not become an automaker, but it still wants to develop its own self-driving technology.

headline.main: Apple Is Shifting the Focus of Its Secret Car Project
headline.print_headline: Apple Is Shifting the Focus of Its Secret Car Project

snippet: Multinational companies should refrain from tax-avoidance practices and pay their fair share, the head of euro zone finance ministers said on Saturday in a new endorsement of the European Union's fight against tax-dodging.

headline.main: 'Times Are Changing, Pay Your Taxes', Euro Zone Chief Tells Corporations
headline.print_headline: 'Times Are Changing, Pay Your Taxes', Euro Zone Chief Tells Corporations

snippet: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd on Saturday urged users of its Galaxy Note 7 phones to turn in their handsets as soon as possible as part of a recall aimed at limiting the damage caused by the fire-prone devices.

headline.main: Samsung Urges Note 7 Users to Switch Off Phones and Turn Them In
headline.print_headline: Samsung Urges Note 7 Users to Switch Off Phones and Turn Them In

snippet: Uber’s experiment with autonomous vehicles is proceeding with the blessing of city officials, who have pretty much just stayed out of the way.

headline.main: No Driver? Bring It On. How Pittsburgh Became Uber’s Testing Ground
headline.print_headline: No Driver? Bring It On. How Pittsburgh Became Uber’s Test City.
